channel.title: Web Design into Template?
channel.description:
How can you take a web design into a template?
For example: http://pootato.org/tutorials/html/image-maps-coordinates/
On the top, where it says, "You are currently browsing the page Image Maps Coordinates in the HTML category." How was it possible for them to put text on that area? CSS?

item.title: Web Design into Template?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

I sliced it before: http://www.007pkerz.com/rl/editoral.html , what’s the next process? Can you either tell me what’s the thing to do next or link a tut?

Read full topic

item.title: Web Design into Template?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Don’t do imagemaps. You slice it with the slice tool. then export it as a file. Then you write the CSS to place it in the location it needs to be placed.

Read full topic

item.title: Web Design into Template?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

What does this do? And I don’t want to use image maps.

Read full topic

item.title: Web Design into Template?
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

<div id="topimg"><div class="map">
									<p>You are currently browsing the page <b>Image Maps Coordinates</b> in the <b>HTML</b> category.</p>

</div>
</div>
#topimg {
width:900px;
height:200px;
background:url(design/topimg.jpg) no-repeat;
clear:both;
margin-bottom:0px;
}
#topimg .map{
width:250px;
height:200px;
position:relative;
top:75px;
left:500px;
color:#FFF;
}

yea css

Read full topic
